dialog.line: I've told you two before! Don't pick up all those magazines unless you're going to buy one; this is a shop not a library. Now girls, what can I get you?
Go on Emma, what was it you wanted?
Er, 20 of those in the silver packet please...
Cigarettes? So how old are you?
16 of course, she wouldn't be asking otherwise would she?
Don't get clever miss. It might surprise you to know under age people do ask for ciggies sometimes.
Well we're in year 11, so it's ok.
What do you mean it doesn't matter you stupid cow? You promised didn't you?
Without proof of age I'm not selling you cigarettes, sorry girls.
All right, I'll have some chocolate instead. Get me two of those bars and three packets of crisps Emma. Doesn't matter what flavour.
Um, can I have these please, and three packets of crisps?
Are you all right love? Why are you buying things for her?
Cos she's my mate, aren't you Emma? What's it got to do with you?
Here you are then, and your change.
How much you got left then? £2? Good, I'll have that. You didn't think you were going to keep the change just because he wouldn't let me have the fags did you?
No Joanne. Here you are. I haven't got any more on me today.
God Emma, you're so pathetic. I'll see you tomorrow. I'll be needing more chocolate. By the way, you get sweaty pits when you're scared.
